The sketch should include the following loops and lines on face 1: - Line 1: (0, 0) to (0.75, 0) - Line 2: (0.75, 0) to (0.75, 0.75) - Line 3: (0.75, 0.75) to (0, 0.75) - Line 4: (0, 0.75) to (0, 0) Step 3: Scale the 2D sketch Scale the 2D sketch by 0.75x. Step 4: Extrude the 2D sketch Extrude the 2D sketch along the Z-axis by 0.75 units resulting in a 3D model with a flat top and bottom. Part 2: 3D Model of a Rectangular Prism with a Slightly Tapered Top and Bottom Step 1: Create a coordinate system Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: (0°, 0°, -90°) - Translation Vector: (0, 0, 0.375) Step 2: Draw two 2D sketches on the X-Y plane In this step, draw two 2D sketches on the X-Y plane of the created coordinate system, one for each face (face 1 and face 2). Step 4: Extrude the 2D sketches Extrude the 2D sketches along the Z-axis. For face 1, keep the normal direction intact, whereas for face 2, extrude -0.75x in the opposite direction of normal resulting in a 3D model with a slightly tapered top and bottom.</description>
